dt.un: used to say that something has come to be considered one of the best of its kind classic novels/movies a classic case study on hysteria He collects classic cars.
used to say that something is an example of excellence His winning goal was classic.

used to describe something that has been popular for a long time classic board games The recipe is a new version of a classic dish. a radio station that plays classic rock [=rock music from the past that is still popular]

def.dt: :having a graceful design with simple lines She prefers classic furniture designs. It's a classic suit that won't go out of style. I like the car's classic contours.

:very typical The battle was a classic example/case of poor planning. a classic error (informal) She lost the tickets? How classic. [=it is not surprising that she lost the tickets; she often loses things]

:something that has been considered to be excellent for a long time That car is a classic. film/literary classics I like to read the classics. Their latest album is destined to become a classic. [=it is very good and will still be admired many years from now]
:the study of the literature, language, and culture of ancient Greece and Rome He teaches classics at the local university. She studied classics in college. an interest in the classics
:a traditional event The football game is a Thanksgiving classic.
